title: How to Make Your Child Wealthier Than You: Easy Steps to Build Generational Wealth
subtitle: Learn simple investment strategies to secure your child's financial future.
content:
How to Make Your Child Wealthier Than You: Easy Steps to Build Generational Wealth

I'm Tyler, a former financial advisor and portfolio manager. Now I make financial content for free so you don't have to pay for it.

1. Invest in a UGMA Account

Invest $50 a week in a UGMA. This is a custodial brokerage account for minors. That's $2,600 a year. Invest it in a growth fund like Vanguard's VUG, which has historically returned 10 to 12% post-inflation. If you do this from birth to age 18 and then stop, by age 65, your child will have $8.7 million with only a total investment of $47,000.

2. Fund a Custodial Roth IRA

Have your kid work for your business and legally pay them $7,000 a year. They should put it all in VUG as well. If you do this from age 10 to 18 and then stop contributing, by age 65, they will have $4.2 million—and it’s all 100% tax-free with a total investment of $56,000.

3. Continue Contributions to the Custodial Roth

If they keep contributing to the same custodial Roth IRA from age 18 to 65 and max it out every year with another $7,000, they could end up with $18.3 million by age 65, also 100% tax-free.

Your Role in This

That's generational wealth, all for helping your child shred some paper and continuing good investment habits as they get older.
